intro: Dryopoa dives, commonly known as the purple needlegrass, is a perennial grass native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking purple-tinted leaves. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas. Its flowering spikes produce small, spikelet-like flowers that are typically green or brown. Dryopoa dives plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
